intro: Adenostemma parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered adenostemma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in clusters, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Adenostemma parviflorum is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in semi-arid conditions.
